talk0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_00>I wish I could allow the children to play
here in the square,<sp:5:0:0> but I simply cannot
remove the sludge stains.
Do you know what Prince Sidon said when
I told him as much?

With a glorious smile, he said, "While King
Dorephan is away, the children may play
in the <clr:0000>throne room<clr:ffff>."
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy>Such kindness! My wife and I were
quite impressed.
talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting>I am working hard to scrub off the sludge.


Next I must help clean up the plaza!
That dreaded sludge fell there as well.
talk0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting>After I finish a bit more of my cleaning
here, I will move on to the plaza! That
dreaded sludge fell there as well.
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>He is off investigating the sludge.


Without its master, his throne room
was quiet and somewhat miserable...
but that is no longer the case.
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>My children are even now running wild in
there, pretending to be King Dorephan.
talk0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Chat_01>I must clean the sludge off thoroughly!


<sp:3:0:2:0601>If I don't work hard, our young Zora
children will not have the chance to
grow and learn to speak eloquently.
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0601><snd:Work_00>Now, it is time to clean and then clean
some more!

After all, clean water is the lifeblood of
the Zora, as we live out our days within
the waves.
talk0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:LaughS>This square is usually so filled with the
laughter of children that it's almost
deafening.
That is why I am cleaning the sludge so
fervently. I hope to see that wonderful
liveliness return once again!
talk0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Greeting_00>I didn't realize the time. I should call it
quits soon.
talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>Sheesh... <sp:5:0:0>If I fail to clean this completely,
the sludge mixes into the water, and
it spreads.
And if it enters your gills, it causes
nothing but trouble!<sp:5:1:0> Your body breaks
down until you can hardly move.
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>I must work tirelessly so that our children
live long enough to speak with true
Zora eloquence!
talk0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Ease>Oh, those yummy fish that Mei brings
home...<sp:5:1:0> Mmm... <sp:5:0:0>I start drooling just
thinking about them!
talk0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>I cannot believe I have been gifted the joy
of watching my children sleep and talking
to my lovely wife again.
Our gratitude is beyond words, Link.
talk0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>The only thing I can boast about is that I
am lucky enough to have Mei as my wife.<sp:5:0:0>
She fills my heart, as well as my stomach!
talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>On evenings when I am worn down from
work, <sp:5:0:0>I delight in relaxing with my family.<sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0101>I hope that we can enjoy days like this for
as long as we live.
talk0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Chat_01>Wow! <sp:5:0:0>I can scarcely believe that someone
was able to make it to the domain through
all of that nasty sludge!
<sp:3:0:2:0101>All the more reason that I must work
tirelessly to restore our beautiful
Zora's Domain.
talk0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Chat_01>Today I am once more going to try my
best to fix up the domain.
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Ease_01>I am so glad that my children did not fall
victim to that detestable sludge.
talk0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive>l intend to persuade Mei to stay nearby.
My heart cannot stand any more worry!

That said, who knows how long my
persuasions will last...
talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>Link!<sp:5:1:0> I am so grateful to you for finding
my beloved Mei!

I believe she finally learned her lesson.
She likely won't give in to overconfidence
after all that has transpired.
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>Well... <sp:5:0:0>For a while, anyway.<sp:5:0:0> Heh.
talk0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:LaughS_01>We Zora tend to speak more eloquently
after reaching middle age.

I hope that when I reach 100 years, I will
also speak as beautifully as our elders.
Unless that is too...OLD-fashioned, heh.
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>Get it? Old? Ahem...<sp:5:0:0> I truly have no flair
for humor. I should have shown more
restraint.
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Chat_01>Now that the sludge is gone, the fish
have returned.

<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_00>And my dear wife, Mei, is elated now
that she can work again for the first time
in a while. She caught some tasty fish!
<sp:3:0:2:0001>We sell some of what we catch to the
general store, so you should swing by
if you have the time.
talk0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Chat_01>Now that the sludge is gone and we can
catch fish again, it finally feels like things
are returning to normal.
talk0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0601><snd:Work_00>Now, it is time to clean!


Clean water is the lifeblood of the Zora,
as we live out our days within the waves.
talk0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Chat_01>The Hyrule bass that Mei caught
was...<sp:5:0:0>exquisitely fatty! Truly succulent!

<sp:3:0:2:0001>She delivered it freshly caught.<sp:5:1:0> Sure, it is
by no means an uncommon fish, but the
freshness made all the difference.
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>I am so happy that my treasured wife is
a master of fishing!
talk0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think_00>I am so weary...<sp:5:0:0> I cannot wait to eat.


I wonder what kind of fish Mei
caught for us today...
